body.p: This is the second developer preview edition of Couchbase Query Language released November 2013.

ul.li: Introducing date/time features in this release. Specifically two new functions DATE_PART and NOW_STR have been added. We will likely expand capabilities in this area in subsequent releases.

Performance Improvements: Better use of indexes. These are internal improvements in the engine, for example, queries covered by index can eliminate the Fetch operator; find by id queries need not scan the index at all; MIN changed to use index.e
Minor syntax improvements – Example, AS keyword is now optional
Stability – various bug fixes to help improve the stability of query engine
Issue: MB-9325 - Add initial date and time features.
Issue: MB-9189 - Queries covered by index now avoid the FETCH operator.
Issue: MB-9187 - Find by id queries now optimized to not scan an index at all.
Issue: MB-9138 - Make AS keyword optional.
Issue: MB-9060 - MIN now optimized to use index.
Issue: MB-9206 - DISTINCT behaved unexpectedly when used in combination with the GROUP BY clause.
Issue: MB-9136 - Make IN optional in OVER..IN clauses.

body.p: This release is a Developer Preview and is not meant to be used in Production.
